N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 30.6 - Issuance of license

State Regulations
(a) Licenses
for major facilities which will be in operation on July 1, 1978, or which will
commence operation between July 1, 1978 and July 31, 1978, will be issued or
denied by the department within 60 days of receipt of a completed application
by the department. All other licenses or renewals of licenses for major
facilities will be issued or denied within 90 days of receipt of a completed
application by the department. (b) Any denial of a license to operate a major facility shall be accompanied by a
statement of the reason or reasons for such denial. (c) All licenses to operate a major facility
shall contain the following general conditions: (1)
the license shall expire March 31st, annually; (2)
the payment of the
license fees required by section
30.9
of this Part shall be a
condition of the license; (3)
the
department shall promptly be notified of any changes in the major facility's
design, construction, operation or maintenance which would materially affect
the potential for a petroleum discharge; (4)
the department shall promptly be
furnished with any amendments or changes to any Coast Guard plan, SPCC plan or
other plan submitted with, or referred to in, the license
application; (5)
substantial
progress toward full implementation, and timely full implementation of any

Coast Guard plan, SPCC plan or other plan submitted by an applicant in order to
demonstrate compliance with the requirements for a major facility license shall
be a condition of the license; and
(6)
as a condition of the license, the owner
or operator of the major facility shall provide access to the facility to
representatives of the department and of the Department of Environmental

Conservation during normal working hours for the purpose of checking compliance
with these regulations, Federal regulations and all general and special
conditions of the license. (d) The department may also insert special
conditions or requirements in a license either on its own initiative or upon
the request of the Department of Environmental Conservation. Special conditions
or requirements inserted upon the request of the Department of Environmental

Conservation shall be denominated in the license as "inserted upon the request
of the Department of Environmental Conservation". Special conditions or
requirements may be inserted in a license only upon initial issuance or upon
renewal. Notes
